Person.Organization: MICHAEL E DEBAKEY VA MEDICAL CENTERUNIVERSITY OF TX MD ANDERSON CAN CTRBAYLOR COLLEGE OF MEDICINE

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This study was supported through 2 grants 1X01HG007923 and R01CA231141-01 from the National Cancer Institute (NCI). Genotype data was generated on biospecimens provided by the Center for International Blood and Marrow Transplant Research (CIBMTR) Research Repository and phenotype data collected by the CIBMTR Research Database. The CIBMTR is supported primarily by Public Health Service grant/cooperative agreement U24CA076518 with the National Cancer Institute (NCI), the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI) and the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID); grant/cooperative agreement U24HL138660 with NHLBI and NCI; grant U24CA233032 from the NCI; grants OT3HL147741, R21HL140314 and U01HL128568 from the NHLBI; contract HHSH250201700006C with Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA); grants N00014-18-1-2888, N00014-17-1-2850 and N00014-20-1-2705 from the Office of Naval Research; subaward from prime contract award SC1MC31881-01-00 with HRSA; subawards from prime grant awards R01HL131731 and R01HL126589 from NHLBI; subaward from prime grant award 5R01CA2151343 from NIH Cancer Institute. P01CA111412, R01CA152108, R01CA218285;R01CA231141, R01HL126589, R01HL129472, R01HL131731 and U01AI126612 from the NIH.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation and Cell Therapy, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-HCTCT-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation and Cell Therapy. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
